item.title: David add a quote by Andre Dubus
item.description: "It is not hard to live through a day, if you can live through a moment." -- Andre Dubus

item.title: David add a quote by Dennis Lehane
item.description: "Happiness doesn't lie in conspicuous consumption and the relentless amassing of useless crap. Happiness lies in the person sitting beside you and your ability to talk to them. Happiness is clear-headed human interaction and empathy. Happiness is home. And home is not a house-home is a mythological conceit. It is a state of mind. A place of communion and unconditional love. It is where, when you cross its threshold, you finally feel at peace." -- Dennis Lehane

item.title: David add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I have two rules in life - to hell with it, whatever it is, and get your work done." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: David add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Be steady and well-ordered in your life so that you can be fierce and original in your work." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: David add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: David add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You have to know how to accept rejection and reject acceptance." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: David add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "We must be willing to let go of the life we planned so as to have the life that is waiting for us." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: David add a quote by Dylan Thomas
David add a quote by Alfred Hitchcock
item.description: "There is no terror in the bang, only in the anticipation of it." -- Alfred Hitchcock

item.title: David add a quote by Alfred Hitchcock
item.description: "Drama is life with the dull parts left out." -- Alfred Hitchcock

item.title: David add a quote by Sun Tzu
item.description: "Wheels of justice gind slow but grind fine" -- Sun Tzu

item.title: David add a quote by Alan Moore
item.description:
"<i>Roschach's Journal: October 12th, 1985</i>
Dog carcass in alley this morning, tire tread on burst stomach. This city is afraid of me. I have seen its true face.
The streets are extended gutters and the gutters are full of blood and when the drains finally scab over, all the vermin will drown.
The accumulated filth of all their sex and murder will foam up about their waists and all the whores and politicians will look up and shout "Save us!"... and I'll look down and whisper "No." -- Alan Moore
